snippet: It seems increasingly likely that a fund-raiser fabricated the four investors whom producers were relying on, according to a lawyer for the Broadway musical’s lead producer.
abstract: Federal investigation into the scuttled Broadway musical Rebecca shows that it is increasingly likely that Mark C Hotton fabricated the all four of the mysterious investors whom producers were relying on for $4.5 million of the show's $12 million budget.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and PATRICK HEALY

lead_paragraph: It seems increasingly likely that a fund-raiser fabricated the four investors whom producers were relying on, according to a lawyer for the Broadway musical’s lead producer.

headline.seo: Commission Was Involved in $4.5 Million Financing for ‘Rebecca’
headline.main: Commission Was at Stake in Financing for ‘Rebecca’
headline.print_headline: Intermediary Stood to Gain In Financing For ‘Rebecca’
